intro: Leiostemon thurberi, commonly known as Thurber's sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky habitats. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Leiostemon thurberi is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems.
